oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A parametrization for dissipative behaviors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PENDHARKAR, I
PILLAI, HK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dynamical-systems
behavioral theory
dissipative systems
passivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The behavioral equivalent of single input single output (SISO) systems are behaviors with two manifest variables. Passive SISO systems can, therefore, be viewed as J-dissipative behaviors with two manifest variables. Here the special matrix J defines a QDF that captures the passivity property of SISO systems. In this paper, we investigate more general QDFs Q(Phi)s induced by some operator Phi. These QDFs define some relation between the input, the output and their derivatives of a SISO system. We characterize all behaviors that are dissipative with respect to the prescribed QDF Q(Phi). In fact, we parametrize all the behaviors dissipative with respect to Q(Phi) in terms of those dissipative with respect to the special QDF Q(j) induced by the matrix J. Similar results can also be given for lossless systems. (C) 2003
